paper_abstract: We develop a numerical method for a generalized nonlocal elastic model, which is expressed as a composition of a Riesz potential operator with a fractional differential operator, by composing a collocation method with a finite difference discretization. By carefully exploring the structure of the coefficient matrix of the numerical method, we develop a preconditioned fast Krylov subspace method, which reduces the computations to (N log N) per iteration and the memory to O (N). The use of the preconditioner significantly reduces the number of iterations, and the preconditioner can be inverted in O (N log N) computations. Numerical results show the utility of the method. (C) 2015 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A fast method for a generalized nonlocal elastic model
